Content:: Olayinka Koso-Thomas (born 1937) is a Nigerian-born doctor who lives in Sierra Leone.[1] She is known internationally for her efforts to abolish female genital cutting. In 1998, she shared a Prince of Asturias Award for this work.[2] This Nigerian biographical article related to medicine is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
